definition: Sunwu county in Heihe 黑河[Hei1 he2], Heilongjiang
grandson/descendant
surname Sun
surname Wu/area comprising southern Jiangsu, northern Zhejiang and Shanghai/name of states in Southern China at different historical periods
Sunwu county in Heihe 黑河[Hei1 he2], Heilongjiang

sentences.english: The Wu mainly followed the institution of the Han Dynasty except that woman was limited to a certain extent.
sentences.chinese: 孙吴基本上承袭汉制，但女性受到一定程度的限制。

sentences.english: Shari-Yue was an active minority during Sun-Wu regime.
sentences.chinese: 山越是孙吴时期活动频繁的一个民族。

sentences.english: The strata in the south-central basin has long been assigned to the Neogene Sunwu Formation.
sentences.chinese: 长期以来，盆地中南部的地层被划为古近系孙吴组。

sentences.english: Therefore, during half past century, Yiyang was controled by the martial supervision from Wu State.
sentences.chinese: 所以，在半个多世纪里，孙吴一直将益阳置于部。

sentences.english: After Western Jin's south unification, some of the Kingdom Wu's system retained.
sentences.chinese: 西晋统一南方后，孙吴旧制还有所保留。

definition: Eastern Wu (222-280)/the southern state of Wu during the Three Kingdoms period, founded by Sun Quan 孫權|孙权
Cao Wei, the most powerful of the Three Kingdoms, established as a dynasty in 220 by Cao Pi 曹丕, son of Cao Cao, replaced by Jin dynasty in 265
Sun Quan (reigned 222-252), southern warlord and king of state of Wu 吳|吴 in the Three Kingdoms period
Shu Han (c. 200-263), Liu Bei's kingdom in Sichuan during the Three Kingdoms, claiming legitimacy as successor of Han
Sun Ce (175-200), general and major warlord of the Later Han Dynasty
Liu Biao (142-208), warlord
Jiangdong district of Ningbo city 寧波市|宁波市[Ning2 bo1 shi4], Zhejiang
Lü Meng (178-219), general of the southern state of Wu
Wu state (in south China, in different historical periods)/Wu state 220-280, founded by Sun Quan 孫權|孙权 the southernmost of the three Kingdoms
Liu Bei (161-223), warlord at the end of the Han dynasty and founder of the Han kingdom of Shu 蜀漢|蜀汉 (c. 200-263), later the Shu Han dynasty
Sichuan/the state of Shu in Sichuan at different periods/the Shu Han dynasty (214-263) of Liu Bei 劉備|刘备 during the Three Kingdoms
Sun Jian (155-191), famous general at end of Han dynasty, forerunner of the southern kingdom of Wu of the Three Kingdoms
Wei State (407-225 BC), one of the Seven Hero States of the Warring States 戰國七雄|战国七雄/Wei State or Cao Wei 曹魏 (220-265), the most powerful of the Three Kingdoms

Battle of Redcliff of 208 at Chibi in Huangzhou district 黃州區|黄州区 of Huanggang city 黄冈, a decisive defeat of Cao Cao 曹操 at the hands of southern kingdom of Wu/famous episode in the Romance of the Three Kingdoms 三國演義|三国演义
Yuan Shao (153-202), general during late Han, subsequently warlord
Lu Su or Lu Zijing 魯子敬|鲁子敬 (172-217), statesman, diplomat and strategist of Eastern Wu 東吳|东吴
